message.content:
cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CR 

This paper discusses the effects of changing evaluation criteria on research performance, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The focus on research productivity and evaluation exercises suggests cs.DL (Digital Libraries) and cs.CY (Computers and Society) as the most likely categories. The use of comparative measures and policy objectives also points towards cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the mention of opportunistic behaviors and the need for functional rules suggests cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as a possible category.
